meanings.definition: Having a liking or affection for something
meanings.sent1: She is very fond of ice cream.
meanings.sent2: He has always been fond of animals.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed fond of chasing its own tail.
meanings.sent4: Her fond memories of childhood always bring a smile.
meanings.sent5: The old man's fond gaze at the family photo spoke volumes.

meanings.sent1: The couple shared a fond embrace.
meanings.sent2: She gave him a fond smile before leaving.
meanings.sent3: The puppy's fond licks made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: His fond words melted her heart instantly.
meanings.sent5: The fond look in her eyes said more than words ever could.

meanings.sent1: Don't fondly believe everything you hear.
meanings.sent2: He fondly thought he could fly like a bird.
meanings.sent3: The comedian fondly joked about his own clumsiness.
meanings.sent4: She fondly danced around the room pretending to be a ballerina.
meanings.sent5: Their plan to sneak into the movie theater was fondly ridiculous.

meanings.definition: To be excessively indulgent or doting
meanings.sent1: She fondly spoiled her grandchildren with treats.
meanings.sent2: He fondly pampered his pet with luxurious toys.
meanings.sent3: The mother fondly allowed her child to eat ice cream for dinner.
meanings.sent4: They fondly showered their new puppy with endless toys.
meanings.sent5: The teacher fondly indulged the students with extra recess time.
